alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Rutherford; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued October 12 at 4:30PM CDT until October 12 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN DAVIDSON...NORTHWESTERN RUTHERFORD AND NORTHEASTERN WILLIAMSON COUNTIES... At 430 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Nashville to 7 miles southeast of Franklin, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Nashville, Smyrna, Brentwood, La Vergne, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Hermitage, Antioch, Rural Hill, Berry Hill, Triune, Percy Priest Lake and Green Hill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 206 and 222. Interstate 65 between mile markers 69 and 87. Interstate 24 between mile markers 47 and 72. Interstate 840 between mile markers 33 and 51. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
